Goal: Keep examining the tidy tuesday dataset on San Francisco Rent
Product: 
Data: San Francisco Rent
Interpretation:  


```{r load-packages, message=FALSE}
library(tidyverse) 
library(tidyr)
library(tidytuesdayR)
library(tidymodels)
library(openintro)
library(broom)
```


```{r import-data}

tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2022-07-05')
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2022, week = 27)

rent <- tuesdata$rent
```


```{r drop-na}

rent <- rent %>%
  drop_na(beds)%>%
  drop_na(baths) %>%
  drop_na(sqft)

rent<-rent[rent$room_in_apt != 1, ]

rent<- subset(rent, select = -c(address,lat, lon,descr, room_in_apt, details) )

```

This got us down to 14,000 from 200,000 observations.
